ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: About 1 hour per week for reading materials.
An hour when we had to present.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great addition to the seminar series. It's very helpful to be familiar with the research before attending the seminar lecture. Love the new format with students presenting!
It's a great opportunity for all EHS students to discuss the current issues or trends of public health.

We get a pretty good spread of speakers! I'd love to see more environmental epidemiology. My biggest problem was the seminars was how they often ran over. I had a class right at 1:00 in the room seminars were held, and with them constantly running 5-10 minutes over, we were never able to start class on time, which was frustrating.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Ying Chen  Ying is very friendly and eager to teach! I love her enthusiasm and willingness to admit she isn't an expert in everything.
Instructor: Ying Chen  Great. She gave us a lots of valuable suggestion.

Instructor: Ying Chen  Dr. Chen has great insight about the articles we read, but doesn't always attempt to spur on discussion as best as possible during journal club. I think the format needs to change a bit, though I don't know how to best approach that.
Instructor: Ying Chen  Ying organized the class very well each time. And the discussion is an opportunity to prepare the seminar.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a good addition to the EHS seminar series (plus free lunch!)
Maybe yes. You can get a change to communicate with other students in your major and get more information from others.
